column4: Is there anyway to view a list of commands inside the terminal?
not really. ls -l /bin/, ls -l /usr/bin/ at least will give you something to play with. :-)
Yeah I kinda figured that directory would only give me a few bits. Oh well.
tab is handy, yes. completes all kinds of things. paths and filenames too
tab completes if only one thing matches, tab tab gives a list of matches if there's more than one
Indeed I been in the Linux world years ago but forgot all to use all the nifty stuff.
Always good to have a list of commands available if you intend to write shell scripts. :)
the list would be just too big..
No kidding right but there are some treasures to be found.
awk, sed, cut and grep will get you far. :-)
there's a few bash shell scripting guides out there too. some are quite good.
with lots of neat little tricks.
it's nice to have a general idea of what's possible with the builtin commands. many things are. :)
I looked at some tutorials but I just didn't like the way it was conformed.
Should be able to check from the terminal command: lspci
